question: What is an Array in C language.?
option1: A) A group of elements of same data type.
option2: B) An array contains more than one element
option3: C) Array elements are stored in memory in continuous or contiguous locations.

question: Choose a correct statement about C language arrays.
option1: A) An array address is the address of first element of array itself.
option2: B) An array size must be declared if not initialized immediately.
option3: C) Array size is the sum of sizes of all elements of the array.

question: What are the Types of Arrays.?
An array Index starts with.?
Choose a correct statement about C language arrays.
option1: A) An array size can not changed once it is created.
option2: B) Array element value can be changed any number of times
option3: C) To access Nth element of an array students, use students[n-1] as the starting index is 0.

question: What is the output of C Program.? int main() { int a[]; a[4] = {1,2,3,4}; printf("%d", a[0]); }
What is the output of C Program.? int main() { int a[] = {1,2,3,4}; int b[4] = {5,6,7,8}; printf("%d,%d", a[0], b[0]); }
What is the output of C Program.? int main() { char grade[] = {'A','B','C'}; printf("GRADE=%c, ", *grade); printf("GRADE=%d", grade); }
option1: A) GRADE=some address of array, GRADE=A
option2: B) GRADE=A, GRADE=some address of array

question: What is the output of C program.? int main() { char grade[] = {'A','B','C'}; printf("GRADE=%d, ", *grade); printf("GRADE=%d", grade[0]); }
What is the output of C program.? int main() { float marks[3] = {90.5, 92.5, 96.5}; int a=0; while(a<3) { printf("%.2f,", marks[a]); a++; } }
What is the output of C Program.? int main() { int a[3] = {10,12,14}; a[1]=20; int i=0; while(i<3) { printf("%d ", a[i]); i++; } }
What is the output of C program.? int main() { int a[3] = {10,12,14}; int i=0; while(i<3) { printf("%d ", i[a]); i++; } }
What is the output of C Program.? int main() { int a[3] = {20,30,40}; a[0]++; int i=0; while(i<3) { printf("%d ", i[a]); i++; } }
What is the output of C program with arrays.? int main() { int a[3] = {20,30,40}; int b[3]; b=a; printf("%d", b[0]); }
What is the output of C Program with arrays and pointers.? int main() { int a[3] = {20,30,40}; int (*p)[3]; p=&a; printf("%d", (*p)[0]); }
What is the output of C program with arrays and pointers.? int main() { int a[3] = {20,30,40}; int *p[3]; p=&a; printf("%d", *p[0]); }
What is the output of C program with arrays and pointers.? int main() { int a[3] = {20,30,40}; printf("%d", *(a+1)); }
What is an array Base Address in C language.?
option1: A) Base address is the address of 0th index element.
option2: B) An array b[] base address is &b[0]
option3: C) An array b[] base address can be printed with printf("%d", b);

question: What is the output of C Program with arrays and pointers.? void change(int[]); int main() { int a[3] = {20,30,40}; change(a); printf("%d %d", *a, a[0]); } void change(int a[]) { a[0] = 10; }
An entire array is always passed by ___ to a called function.
